description: Borrowed from Latin septentriōnālis, from septentriōnēs (“seven plow oxen”), a name for the constellations now known as Ursa Major and Ursa Minor, which appear in the northern sky.

adjectives.description: septentrional (comparative more septentrional, superlative most septentrional)

entries.meaning: (rare, literary) Pertaining to the north; northern.
examples: Cow's milk could be obtained in very small quantities, but it was of evil flavour; butter, in the septentrional sense of the word, did not exist.
